info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 1:09PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW PRODUCING SLICK TRAVEL FOR SIERRA PASSES FRIDAY MORNING... A weak storm system will move quickly across the Sierra and northeast California late tonight and Friday, bringing increased winds and a period of snow capable of producing slick travel conditions and delays across the main Sierra passes through the Friday morning commute. * Winds: Most of the stronger winds will remain in higher elevations, with ridge level gusts 65-75 mph late tonight and Friday. For lower elevations, wind gusts of 25-35 mph are expected. * Snow: A period of snow will arrive early Friday morning, with peak snowfall rates most likely between 4 and 9 AM. The main Sierra passes including Fredonyer Summit, Yuba Pass, Donner and Echo summits, and Carson Pass can expect accumulations of 3 to 6 inches through Friday morning. Lighter snowfall up to 2 inches is possible across the remainder of the Lake Tahoe basin and northeast California west of US-395 near and above 5500 feet. If traveling across the Sierra Friday morning, be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. Conditions are expected to improve from late morning through the remainder of Friday as the snow diminishes to scattered snow showers and higher April sun angles allow snow to melt on paved surfaces.
